channel.title: GitHub repository in Eclipse -- need help on run configurations
channel.description:
So I got this repository from GitHub, cloned it to my laptop and imported it to Eclipse as a Local Repository but now I can't run it (or build it). When I attempt to run it it gives me the following error: "The selection cannot be launched, and there are no recent launches".
I've looked up what that meant and apparently it means that since you didn't create this project there is no build path or run configurations associated with the project. (Note that there's also no .PROJECT file in the project itself).
The repository shows in the Git Repositories panel and right clicking it won't give me any option to set its Run Configurations or anything. Selecting Run Configurations from the top menu allows me to make a custom configurations but when I hit Search it won't find my project (so I can't select the main file either).
Some help/advice woul be nice :)

item.title: GitHub repository in Eclipse -- need help on run configurations
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

Justin Bieber:

Could always create a new eclipse project and just copy over the .project file

Exactly what I did and it worked
Made a new project, copied over the .classpath and .project files and changed everything accordingly.
Re-imported the project with the files and selected the main file and it worked ^^

Read full topic
item.source: GitHub repository in Eclipse -- need help on run configurations

item.title: GitHub repository in Eclipse -- need help on run configurations

item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Could always create a new eclipse project and just copy over the .project file

Read full topic
